title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Holyoke, MA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted and had an initial interview with the recruiter and then ended up having a panel zoom interview. They said up to six managers could join the meeting, but only two of them did. The interview was very stiff and structured. They asked your basic interview questions and there wasn’t a lot of back and forth between the managers.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself?

title: Neurosurgeon Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: Met with different administrators and physicians. It was an all day process. There were follow up phone calls. The chief of neurosurgey sounded genuine. Overall atmosphere was friendly and warm.
Interview Questions: What will you bring to this place?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy, warm, standard questions about background and interests. Reviewed experiences on my resume and asked thoughtful questions. Asked about my intentions to stay in the area. Asked about previous work experiences.
Interview Questions: What are your professional Goals

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: Casual conversation, I decided it wasn't for me. The position would involve cold calling and a lot of uncertainty. I was thinking of a career change but it seemed too risky. Seems like a good opportunity for someone who is less risk averse.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working with us?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Seems like the recruiter do not know enough about what they want employees to do on the med-surg floors. It’s hard to ask general questions because no one knows. Every thing was rushed before your question were even answered. Looks shady
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience?

title: Cybersecurity Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I applied on their website. A recruiter contacted me about the position and scheduled an interview with the CISO. 

I had a Webex with the CISO which was very informal and a casual discussion about my experience, the hospital system and cybersecurity.

A few weeks later they scheduled 3 interviews in the same day with 4 team members (2 on each call) and a followup with the CISO. The conversations were again  informal discussions about my experience, the job , the nature of the hospital's current cybersecurity challenges and future growth. 

After over 3 hours of interviews, several weeks later I received the automated WorkDay  'we are no longer pursuing you as a candidate' e-mail. It feels cold, impersonal and insulting as a candidate - considering this is the same e-mail you  would receive if you never had the opportunity to interview.

I have received this before as an applicant here and at other organizations, but after hours of active interviews it's off-putting and makes me hesitant to apply in the future if this is how candidates are treated. 

This isn't my first time applying here, and the recruitment process has consistently been  unorganized, misinformed or a black hole of communication and reflects poorly on the organization.
Interview Questions: Are you accustomed to working in an unstructured environment?

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: There were three interviews. The first was a brief "screening" type of interview with HR. They asked very basic interview questions. The second was with two dietitians and they asked a mix of clinical and situational questions. The final interview is a panel of dietitians and they primarily ask clinical questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Baystate?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with recruiter who asked general interview questions. Scheduled an interview with the actual location the position was at. It was a phone interview with 2 people. The interview lasted about 30-45 minutes..
Interview Questions: They asked questions such as why do you want to work here? Why do you think you would be a good fit? Describe a time you had a conflict at your workplace and how did you handle it

title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: Very informal. We sat at a table across from each other and chatted about the general responsibilities of the job. It was more of a conversation than a formal interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the emergency room?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: Conversation and interview questions. Nurse manager was so nice and welcoming. She seemed like she really cares about her staff. Babe made it more of a conversation rather than an interview
Interview Questions: Describe a time you got to do what you do best

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baystate Health in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward, expected interview questions for the position for a new nurse. Both the Manager and assistant manager were very nice. Decision to hire came quickly after the interview and I was connected with the appropriate team members.
Interview Questions: Critical thinking and managing stressful environments.

title: Talent Acquisition Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: Multi step, met with manager, then team, virtually.  Seemed like they valued team opinions.  Met with recruiters, admin staff, as well as representatives from other parts of the larger HR organization.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a large requisition load?  How do you deal with tough managers?  Give me example of a time where you went above and beyond?

title: Operations Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baystate Health in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: 1st a phone screening with HR contact which was about 20 minutes. Then a video interview with unit manager & assistant. The video interview was about 30 - 45 minutes. The entire process was smooth and pleasant.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a challenging situation?

title: Cardiac Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: Called a month after my application was submitted. Phone interview was first step then an interview with HR. Then shadowing. Process was average interview. About a month in between phone interview and start of job
Interview Questions: How well do you work in a fast paced environment

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted quickly after submitting my resume. Interview process was clear and fair, there was good follow through during the entire process. I was ultimately offered the position and am pleased with the overall interview process.
Interview Questions: Why was I interested in working with this population?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: quick, uneventful, just a formality,  basic interview questions,  met with supervisor one on one, was in person.  All questions were basic, nothing intense, just basically went over my resume and asked a few questions
Interview Questions: strengths and weaknesses

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, applied and I was sent interview dates to chose from... chose one and got confirmation email. Dressed professional and attended interview as planned. Managers very nice and personable. Staff very nice and welcoming too. Patient load not outrageous.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: It was easy. The people asked easy questions and all was well. Many people interview you.  They ask many questions like what is your experience in customer service. why do you want to work here.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Transportation Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: face to face. First meeting with recruitment. The next meeting is with the manager on the phone. After that you will get a meeting with the manager face to face. Very easy and very easy job.
Interview Questions: Do you have customer experience

title: Counter Help Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Westfield, MA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
called company met with manager two days later. The follow upon their part was not too good.
I felt they led me on a bit, because the manager seemed to like me and said she would call HR, which made it sound as if I had the job.
Interview Questions: What do you know about car parts

title: Cardiac Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: Preliminary phone interview about a month after applying. Then HR interview with a recruiter. Final interview involved with unit managers along with a session of shadowing post interview. Whole process took about a month after first phone interview.
Interview Questions: What strengths of yours will help you adjust to a fast paced acute care setting?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy and organized interview process. They ask about your interests and get to really know you as a person. It was a nice interview process overall. I recommend. anyone who is interested to interview here.
Interview Questions: What are your interests? Which department do you see yourself in?

title: RN-Lateral Transfer to Different Department Not Specialty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA)
Interview Descriptions: No formal interviews took place. Awaiting call back from hr talent aquisitionist to finalize transfer bc I found the right people and took initiative to secure a position and then month goes by with out any call backs,
Interview Questions: Can you walk and stand a lot?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was an in person interview with 2 supervisors. After that one of them showed me around. Less than a week later they offered me a job. Within a week of that I have a physical and a drug test. They want 5 references for the background check.  About 2 weeks after that is orientation. This is a per diem position.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this job?

title: Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: Light and more convorsational than I expected. Very nice and professional with common interview questions. It was quicker than expected and all around positive. Baystate seems lik le a wonderful place and all around the people seem positive
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had a conflict with someone, and you thought that your position was correct. How did you handle that situation?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Worcester, MA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Hope everything will be fine tomorrow as long as you are ready in the interview process you can make it. just be yourself  and tell all about your experiences in your past work. Its starts with why I don't know why it doesn't even matter how hard I try. Keep in mind that everything will be alright.
Interview Questions: how much is your expected salary

title: CMA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was comfortable, welcoming and stressless. Staff was nice and explained the job in great detail.  I did not feel pressured and it was easy to talk without feeling judged
Interview Questions: They asked wiy I prefer speacilaty over PCP

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had the opportunity to shadow and then interviewed after shadowing which gave you a better idea of the position. Avoid dealing with Talent Acquisition department as much as possible; ignored multiple calls, messages, and emails.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Patrol Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the Interim Manager, who was very personable. Talked about the job, and took a tour of the facility. Had to go to employee health, and do the standard health screen.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position at Baystate Healthcare?

title: Chief Financial Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Palmer, MA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Four rounds: 1) screening call with recruiter, 2) in person with HR DIRECTOR then CEO, 3) in person with other senior leaders, 4)  in person with corporate finance executives
Interview Questions: What characteristics do you like in your superior

title: Digital Content Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with a few different people from the department. Although very professional, the meeting was relaxed and candid. The interviewers made me feel comfortable and excited to be hiring someone for the position.
Interview Questions: How long have you been writing/editing?

title: Pharmacy Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 3 different people.  Several questions about what type of work did in McKesson, Pyxis and 403b.  The interview was not structured to be formal. It was very informal and structured around my resume mostly.
Interview Questions: Have you ever used the non McKesson function in connect?

title: Marketing Strategy Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sent in application in May....got an email with questions in June...personal interview in June...even though was told process would be a couple of weeks.....was called in September that they decided not to fill the job after numerous emails. The decision makers kept telling me they would get back to me in a certain timeframe and didn't hit any of these.  Seemed very disjointed.
Interview Questions:
Experience
Management style
Explain certain difficult situations

title: Insurance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with a person in human resources, took a typing test, then setup an interview with the dept head.  I was hired within 3 days, 3/22/1976. I started in collections, then transferred to Admitting for several years, then transferred to the Call Center for my last 20 years.
Interview Questions: Can you work full time

title: Counselor I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by program manager, to describe my background, experience, and what I could offer the program. Manager described the program, the population it serves, and its role in health care and treatment in the geographical area. Manager then offered a tour of the program, including reviewing the program schedule for patients. Then, interviewed by program clinical supervisor (licensed psychologist), to describe treatment modalities and behavioral crisis management.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a child with escalated, unsafe behaviors?

title: Coding Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions:
several interviews with many people, i had to go back 4 different times and once again to meet with the same people i did the first time
seemed like they couldn't make up their mind and made me feel like i was in a personality competition which made me pretty uncomfortable and unsure of whether i wanted to work there.
I really needed a job so i took it when they offered but was uncomfortable right off the bat and wish i never had.
Interview Questions: they asked really strange questions... like... tell me about something you have failed at

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions:
Formal, with many people from the hiring department.panel .can you type,transcribe, manage outlook calendar , excel tables, what software prgs you know. Dress code is proffesional atv all times .etc 
Your previous employeers ..,
Interview Questions: Things you know about the job, how far you live ,can you comit to a certain hours, do you have transportation

title: Practice Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I first was called back by recruiting team and after that interview I was contacted by 2 offices to set up interviews that day. After meeting with both offices i was offered a job about a week later. I applied online first and then the recruiting office reached out to me for a interview
Interview Questions: How do you handle an upset patient?

title: Menta Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: The process was easy and HR was very accommodating. The process took a bit longer than expected from the date of interview to the date of hiring. The good things was that everything was online and took very little time from my schedule.
Interview Questions:
Someone like me that had a lot of education, why do I seek a position in behavioral health?

How do one managed stressful situation and with various behavioral problems?

title: EHR MEDICAL RECORDS SPECIALIST Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on a Saturday, phone interview the very next Monday after the Thanksgiving holiday. Person who i spoke with was very knowledgeable about the position, at the end wanted to schedule an interview. Agreed, scheduled interview for first week in December. Interviewed for position and was told that it takes 30 days to complete any hiring process. Tried to reach out for follow-up an never gotten a  return call.
Interview Questions: Why are you a better fit for this position?

title: Product Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Interviews were highly organized, professional, well versed. Clearly articulated their needs and expectations. 

I met with multiple leaders within the organization and each was pleasure to meet and discuss the requirements of the position as well as the impacts on each area of the organization. 

I enjoyed the process and left confident that I jnderstood the position, my ability to fulfil the expectations of the role, and next steps.
Interview Questions: Do you believe that you are a good fit for this position?

title: Legal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online  and had a telephone interview.   The recruiter was impossible to reach, we played phone tag for almost two weeks. Once we actually were able to talk, she was not prepared to answer the basics about the role, the department of the process.
Interview Questions: Nothing of substance was asked by the recuiter

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed and thorough.  Friendly Human Resource staff to facilitate the interview process. Several steps with 1:1 with HR before proceeding with a panel interview comprised of several staff members I would be working with. Finally meeting with several in leadership positions including the hiring manager, and CNIO and lead of Clinical Informatics.
Interview Questions: What drew you to apply for this position

title: Practice Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fairly easy. Met with recruiter and a week later had a panel interview with multiple personnel. Everyone was very courteous and informative, it made me very excited at the prospect of working at Baystate. A week later I was offered the position. Baystate seems like a very rewarding company, I am very happy to be apart of the Baystate Health Organization.
Interview Questions: Typical questions, just be open and honest.

title: Division Chief Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by numerous faculty and staff as well as department chair. Had two rounds of interviews. Presented a talk to housesat. Second round my spouse was invited at the department's expense and a tour of the area was included. All very helpful.
Interview Questions: What are your personal goals in the next five years.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions:
-Normal meet and greet with a tour of the floor.  No offering of water or coffee, just went through the process like a machine.  Everyone was very nice and pleasant.  They smiled as they shook my hand and greeted me.  The environment was clean and smelt fresh.  The walls were empty, no personalized decor. 

-First interview of the day: consisted of 1:1 with HR representative, discussed essential job skills related to job opening and personal experiences (to make sure I was a good fit). 

-Second interview of the day: consisted of 1:1 with Unit Manager behind closed doors.  Lots of personality/behavior driven questions..."Tell me...?"
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you experienced a conflict with a co-wroker and what you did about it?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was very persistent and called at least twice a week for a full month before being granted an interview. The interview process, once it began, was average in length...about three weeks to begin orientation. Orientation was fairly typical for healthcare and covered key values, direction of the company, introduction to the executives, benefits and paperwork.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest challenge in your current position.

title: Practice Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baystate Health (Springfield, MA) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: I applied through a current employee and then was asked to go to the HR department and fill out a formal application. At HR I was given a personality assessment and then I was interviewed one on one. After about 1 week, I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: If your boss told you to perform a task in a certain manner, but you have come up  with a more effective way of performing this task, how would you go about performing this task.
